intro: Astragalus tupalangi, commonly known as the Tupalangi milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its typical pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Astragalus tupalangi is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
